data.question: What is the empirical formula of UMCM-151?
At what temperature was the crystallographic analysis of UMCM-153 conducted?
What is the space group of UMCM-154?
Does the structure of UMCM-152 belong to the trigonal crystal system?
Is the density of UMCM-153 higher than that of UMCM-152?
What is the reason for the collapse of UMCM-154 upon guest removal?
data.answer: Collapse is attributed to an unstable metal cluster incorporating two monodentate coordinating carboxylates.

data.question: What is the formula weight of UMCM-152?
Is the crystal system of UMCM-153 orthorhombic?
What is the volume of the unit cell for UMCM-151?
What type of metal cluster is present in UMCM-154?
Does UMCM-153 have a higher F(000) value than UMCM-152?
What is the space group number for UMCM-151?
Is the absorption coefficient of UMCM-154 higher than that of UMCM-151?
What is the reason for the high adsorption capacities of UMCM-152 and UMCM-153 for organosulfur compounds?
data.answer: The dramatic differences in capacity of DBT and DMDBT in UMCM-152 and UMCM-153 provide indisputable evidence that liquid phase adsorption is not dependent on surface area or linker or metal cluster identity.

data.question: What is the crystal size of UMCM-153?
Is the BET surface area of UMCM-152 higher than that of UMCM-153?
What is the final R index for UMCM-154 using all data?
Does UMCM-151 have a higher formula weight compared to UMCM-152?
What is the reason for the formation of the three-bladed zinc paddlewheel metal cluster in UMCM-154?
data.answer: The formation of this three-bladed metal cluster over other more common Zn clusters is attributed to the thermodynamic requirements imposed by linker 4 having five carboxylates in a 1:4 symmetry equivalent ratio.
